title: Dimitri Payet departure "not inevitable" as West Ham boss warns wantaway star won't be sold on the cheap
text:

Slaven Bilic has warned West Ham won't sell Dimitri Payet unless someone meets their asking price. 
The Frenchman is desperate to leave the London Stadium and return to Marseille due to personal reasons. 
However, the Ligue 1 club have so far been unable to agree terms with the Hammers, who want £35million for their talisman. 
Bilic has not given up hope of keeping Payet in east London until the end of the season. 
“His departure is not inevitable," the Hammers boss said during Thursday's press conference. Read More Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Payet would take pay cut to move, says Julien Laurens Share this video Watch Next 
“I like to solve situations in house to protect the team. I said everything then and what has changed now? Nothing. 
“It is not a good situation for the club, it is not good for football in general. We took our stand very clearly and it stays the same. 
“We aren’t going to sell our best players on the cheap just because somebody wants to sign them." Jose Fonte wants out of St Mary's (Photo: Getty Images) 
Bilic remained cagey about the Hammers' pursuit of Southampton skipper Jose Fonte, but is hopeful they will get a body through the door shortly. 
He added: "[Fonte is] not having a medical today. We are not talking about transfers, we are working on some though. 
"There are one or two players we need, it won’t be easy, but we are trying. Hopefully have something to announce in 24 hours." poll loading Has Dimitri Payet played his last game for West Ham? 5000+ VOTES SO FAR
